organization.fullName: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Improving In-hospital Stroke Service Utilisation in China
identificationModule.officialTitle: Improving In-hospital Stroke Service Utilisation (MISSION) in China: A Cluster Randomised Trial of Interventions to Shorten Door to Needle Times

leadSponsor.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

collaborators.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
The Central Hospital of Lishui City

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A cluster randomised controlled trial will be conducted, using hospital as randomisation unit. Hospitals in Zhejiang Province, China, will be randomised into two arms (1:1): an intervention arm and a control arm. Hospitals in the intervention arm will receive a multi-components intervention based on the Behaviour Change Wheel model, whereas hospitals in the control arm will receive no intervention and maintain existing care. The randomisation will be conducted after one-year baseline data collection. The following baseline data will be used for randomisation match: hospital classification, beds in stroke centre, thrombolysis patient number, and percentage of patients receiving thrombolysis within 60 minutes of stroke onset. Hospitals with no stroke centre or with \<20 cases received thrombolysis per year will be excluded from the study. The primary outcome will be difference between intervention arm and control arm in the percentage of patients receiving thrombolysis within 60 minutes of stroke onset on the follow-up stage (post-intervention).

armGroups.label: an intervention arm
armGroups.description: Hospitals in the intervention arm will receive a multi-components intervention based on the Behaviour Change Wheel model
interventionNames: Behavioral: Behaviour Change Wheel model guided intervention

armGroups.label: a control arm
armGroups.description: hospitals in the control arm will receive no intervention and maintain existing care

interventions.name: Behaviour Change Wheel model guided intervention
interventions.description: Interventions are developed on a psychological model, the Behaviour Change Wheel (BCW) .The fundamental of BCW consists of three essential elements: capability, motivation, and opportunity. Improving individual's capability, providing motivation, and increasing opportunities are goals of behaviour change intervention. To achieve the goals, 9 intervention components have been proposed in the BCW framework, and 6 components will be used in current study.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in the percentage of patients who Door-to-Needle Time≤60min
primaryOutcomes.description: Difference between intervention arm and control arm in the percentage of patients receiving thrombolysis within 60 minutes of stroke onset on the follow-up stage

secondaryOutcomes.description: The time between hospital arrival and the initiation of IVT
The time between the symptom onset and the initiation of IVT

secondaryOutcomes.measure: modified Rankin Scale score at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: modified Rankin Scale score at discharge, on which scores range from 0 (no neurologic deficit) to 6 (death)
Intracranial hemorrhage at 24 hours associated with an increase of ≥4 points of NIHSS score from baseline, according to European Cooperative Acute Stroke Study (ECASS) II trial
Score of 0 to 1 on the modified Rankin Scale, on which scores range from 0 (no neurologic deficit) to 6 (death)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* AIS patients receiving IVT within 4.5 hours

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who are not willing to attend this trial

locations.facility: The second affiliated hospital of Zhejiang University
